repository.corpname: Special Collections Research Center, The George Washington University

did.physloc: Materials may be stored off-site, and may require additional retrieval time. Please contact the Special Collections Research Center for more information.
did.abstract: This collection contains photographs, slides, scrapbooks, articles, audio cassettes, and correspondence related to the work and life of Dr. Ruth Osborn. Dr. Osborn founded and directed the women's continuing education program at GW titled "Developing New Horizons for Women" from 1964 until her retirement in 1979.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: In 1964, Dr. Ruth Osborn (February 17, 1919 - October 30, 2009) created "Developing New Horizons for Women" a program that became the prototype for women's education programs in the 1960s and 1970s. The GW College of General Studies began the New Horizons for Women in 1964 with a noncredit orientation class of twenty women. "The purpose of the workshop, referred to as 'developing new horizons for women,' is to assist women to develop their potential: by enabling them to understand themselves as individuals and as women by exploring educational, occupational, and community service opportunities; and by analyzing and solving problems encountered when entering the educational and occupational world." (Operation Update, National Business Woman, October 1965). The focus of the GW program was mature married woman students many of whom had bachelors degrees, but had stopped their education and career following their marriages. She directed the GW Continuing Education Center for Women from 1964-1979 and focused her career on making education accessible for married women. Dr. Osborn was an active member of the organization Columbian Women. She received her B.S. from the University of Minnesota and an M.A. and Ed.D from GW. She retired in 1979. In 1998, GW honored Dr. Osborn with a distinguished alumni award.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into 5 series: Scrapbooks, Personal papers, CEW records, Articles, and Columbian Women Scholarship Fund.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection contains reports, photographs, articles, brochures, slides, and scrapbooks. The scrapbooks contain photographs, correspondence, newspaper and magazines articles about Dr. Ruth Osborn and GW's Continuing Education for Women Program. These materials date from 1963-2005. Some of this material relates to the Columbian Women organization. These materials arrived in several donations from Ruth Osborn and have been divided into series related to both her work as an educator of women and the Continuing Education for Women program that she founded at GW.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for research.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Some material may be copyrighted or restricted. It is the patron's obligation to determine and satisfy copyright or other case restrictions when publishing or otherwise distributing materials found in the collections.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Gift of Ruth Osborn, 2009 [2009.068]. This collection also consists of previous donations by Ruth Osborn to the University Archives in 1999 and 2008.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Please cite unpublished materials in the following way:
Please provide the title and date of item, catalog number (if applicable it will be found written on the folder), name of the collection, name of the repository, and location of the repository.

Example: James Oglethorpe to the Trustees, 13 January 1876, RG0001 Series 1, Box 4, Folder 3. Records of the Board of Trustees, Special Collections Research Center, Gelman Library, The George Washington University, Washington, D.C.

otherfindaid.head: Other Finding Aids
otherfindaid.p: Those interested in researching the Columbian Women will find useful http://library.gwu.edu/ead/rg0027.xml

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This series contains scrapbooks that date from 1963-1996. The scrapbooks include photographs, correspondence, newspaper and magazines articles about Dr. Ruth Osborn and GW's Continuing Education for Women Program. Some of this material relates to the Columbian Women organization.
This material was donated by Ruth Osborn from 1999-2008.
Formerly ACC#737

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Arranged chronologically. Some of the earlier scrapbooks arrived in a later accession and thus the box numbers are out of order and some of the scrapbooks overlap in date.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains biographical data related to Dr. Ruth Osborn including awards, correspondence, interviews, articles, and audio cassettes. These records date from 1966-2005. Most of the material relates to Dr. Osborn's work as an educator of women and a champion of the efforts of married women to combined careers with raising families.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains records of the Continuing Education for Women Program called Developing New Horizons through Continuing Education. This program was founded by Dr. Ruth Osborn in 1964. Dr. Osborn "developed the program as the result of her own experience as a mature woman returning to colleage to work on her doctorate. On the George Washington campus, she saw other women like herself seeking new ways to employ their abilities. . . . Dr. Osborn decided that the first need of a returning woman student was encouragement, a restored confidence in her ability to study and work. . . . During 15 two-hour sessions . . . the women gather for lectures and discussions. They hear guest speakers who come to discuss career fields open to women." (Women Moving Ahead by Alice Y. Scates, Ameircan Education March, 1966).
These records include correspondence, audio recordings of CEW events, course related materials such as schedules and course descriptions, a handbook, and slides. These records date from 1964-1997.
Box 1 is unprocessed and the three folders (with original folder titles) have been added to the end of this series.

scopecontent.p: This series contains articles about the Continuting Education Program for Women and also articles more generally about women, education and labor. These materials date from 1959-1992.

did.unittitle: Written by Ruth Osborn: articles and research papers

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains meeting minutes, directories, and other records related to the Columbian Women organization. The Columbian Women, the University's oldest scholarship support group was founded in 1894. These records date from 1957-1996 and come from Ruth Osborn's personal files related to her time with the organization.
This series is not fully processed and may require more time to use for research.
